title: Division Intro
blurb: Learn division through repeated subtraction and discover how multiplication and division work together in fact families.

vocab.definition: Subtracting the same number over and over until you reach zero
A group of related multiplication and division facts using the same three numbers
The answer to a division problem
Operations that undo each other, like multiplication and division

teachingNotes: Begin with concrete examples of repeated subtraction. Show how division is the opposite of multiplication. Practice fact families to strengthen understanding. Use visual models like arrays and equal groups.

sample.question: How many times can you subtract 6 from 48?
Use repeated subtraction: How many 9s are in 63?

truefalse.question: The fact family for 4, 6, and 24 has four facts.
You can find 36 ÷ 4 by subtracting 4 from 36 nine times.
Multiplication and division are inverse operations.
The quotient is the number you divide by.
If you know 9 × 11 = 99, you also know 99 ÷ 9 = 11.

multiplechoice.question: Which fact belongs in the same family as 9 × 12 = 108?
How many times can you subtract 11 from 77?

fillintheblank.question: To find 48 ÷ 6, you can subtract 6 from 48 _____ times.
The fact family for 8, 9, and 72 includes: 8 × 9 = 72, 9 × 8 = 72, 72 ÷ 8 = 9, and _____.
If you subtract 9 from 108 twelve times, you get _____.

wordProblems.question: Maria has 96 stickers to share equally among 8 friends. How many stickers will each friend get?
A teacher has 84 pencils to put into boxes of 12. How many boxes will she need?
There are 72 students going on a field trip. If each bus holds 9 students, how many buses are needed?
Jake collected 132 baseball cards and wants to put them in albums with 11 cards per page. How many pages will he fill?
A bakery made 168 cookies and packages them 14 per box. How many boxes can they fill?
The school library has 150 books to place on shelves. If each shelf holds 15 books, how many shelves will they use?
A farmer planted 91 tomato plants in rows with 7 plants per row. How many rows did he plant?
Emma saved $144 over 12 months. If she saved the same amount each month, how much did she save per month?
A factory produces 108 toys per day and packages them 9 per box. How many boxes do they fill each day?
There are 120 chairs to arrange in rows of 8. How many rows will there be?
